topic.title: HP Helion Openstack 1.1: Attaching and Detaching Volume Instances

body.p: After you've created one or more volumes, you can attach them to instances, one instance at a time.

section.title: Attach a volume to an instance

li.p: Launch the HP Helion Openstack Helion Dashboard.
Click the Compute tab on the dashboard Project panel.
In the Compute panel, click Volumes.
Select the volume to add to an instance and click Edit Attachments.
In the Manage Volume Attachments dialog box, select an instance.
Enter the name of the device from which the volume is accessible by the instance. (Note: The actual device name might differ from the volume name because of hypervisor settings.)

section.p: The dashboard shows the instance to which the volume is now attached and the device name. You can view the status of a volume in the Volumes tab of the dashboard. The volume is either Available or In-use. Now you can log in to the instance and mount, format, and use the disk.

section.title: Detach a volume from a VM instance

li.p: Launch the HP Helion Openstack Helion Dashboard.
Click the Compute tab on the dashboard Project panel.
In the Compute panel, click Volumes.
Select the volume you want to detach and click Edit Attachments.
Click Detach Volume to confirm your changes.
